title: Latvia
excerpt: A Baltic country on the Baltic Sea
text: Latvia is a Baltic country on the eastern shore of the Baltic Sea in Northern Europe. Riga, the capital, is known for its Art Nouveau architecture, which comprises about 40 percent of the city's buildings. Latvia has a population of about 1.9 million and is known for its forests, rivers, and cultural traditions. The Old Town of Riga is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Latvia joined the European Union in 2004 and adopted the Euro in 2014. The country is known for its amber, traditional crafts, and Song Festival. Latvia has a rich cultural heritage with influences from Germanic, Russian, and Polish cultures.
